findings.title: Integer Overflow
findings.description: Potential integer overflow vulnerability due to incorrect ordering of arithmetic operations.

findings.title: Lack of Arbitrary limits
findings.description: The contract does not have arbitrary limits which can lead to unintended behavior and potential security risks.

findings.title: Incorrect Inheritance Order
findings.description: The inheritance order of the contract is incorrect, which can lead to unexpected behavior and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Typographical Errors
findings.description: The audit report mentions Typographical Errors as a common contract vulnerability.

findings.title: Requirement Violation
findings.description: The contract does not meet certain requirements or standards.

findings.title: Gas Optimization
findings.description: Use `external` attribute for the functions which are never called within the contract.

findings.title: Re-entrancy
findings.description: Re-entrancy guard is used to prevent re-entrant calls.

findings.title: Third Party Dependencies
findings.description: Smart contract is interacting with third party protocols e.g., Pancakeswap, Uniswap. The scope of the audit treats third party entities as black boxes and assumes their functional correctness. However, in the real world, third parties can be compromised, and exploited.

findings.title: Irrelevant Codes
findings.description: Presence of unnecessary code in the smart contract.

findings.title: Divide before multiply
findings.description: In the withdraw function of DeltaNeutralVault, multiplying after division without proper method can cause precision loss, leading to failure of _withdrawHealthCheck.
